
OpenSSL commands to chack and verify you tificate, key, and CSR

It can be useful to check a certificate and key before applying them to you server. The following commands hald verify the certificate, key, and csr

1.  Check a certificate and return information about it (signing authority, expiration date, etc.)

    $ openssl x509 -in daytrader-web.crt -text

2.  Check the SSL key and verify the consistency

    $ openssl rsa -in daytrader-web.key -check
 
3.  Check the CSR and print the CSR data filled in when generating the CSR
    
4.  VEeify the certificate and key match by printing their md5 checksums and comparing their checksums for equality

    $ openssl x509 -noout -modulus -in daytrader-web.crt | openssl md5
    $ openssl rsa -noout -modulus -in daytrader-web.key | openssl md5
